functions¶

Functions for Potential and initial wave function psi_0

class supersolids.functions.Resolution(x, y, z)¶
x: float¶

Alias for field number 0

y: float¶

Alias for field number 1

z: float¶

Alias for field number 2

supersolids.functions.camera_3d_trajectory(frame: int, r_func: Optional[Callable] = None, phi_func: Optional[Callable] = None, z_func: Optional[Callable] = None, r_0: float = 10.0, phi_0: float = 45.0, z_0: float = 20.0) → Tuple[float, float, float][source]¶

Computes r, phi, z as the components of the camera position in the animation for the given frame. Depending on, if a callable function is given for the components, it is applied to the parameters or the start values are used.

Parameters

frameint, index

Index of the frame in the animation

r_funcCallable or None

r component of the movement of the camera.

phi_funcCallable or None

phi component of the movement of the camera.

z_funcCallable or None

z component of the movement of the camera.

r_0float

r component of the starting point of the camera movement.

phi_0float

phi component of the starting point of the camera movement.

z_0float

z component of the starting point of the camera movement.

Returns

r, phi, z as the components of the camera position in the animation for the given frame.

supersolids.functions.psi_gauss_1d(x, a: float = 1.0, x_0: float = 0.0, k_0: float = 0.0)[source]¶

Gaussian wave packet of width a and momentum k_0, centered at x_0

Amplitude of pulse

k_0float

Group velocity of pulse

supersolids.functions.psi_gauss_2d_pdf(pos, mu=array([0., 0.]), var=array([[1., 0.], [0., 1.]]))[source]¶

Gives values according to gaus dirstribution (2D) with meshgrid of x,y as input

Parameters

posnp.ndarray 3D

stacked meshgrid of an x (1D) and y (1D)

munp.ndarray 2D

Mean of gauss

varnp.ndarray 2D

Variance of gauss

Returns

z_meshmeshgrid, 2D surface values

values according to gaus dirstribution (2D) with meshgrid of x,y as input
